summary:
I am an R&D engineer and researcher with an interest in developing innovative systems giving the properties required for specific applications and building the knowledge around the product.

My professional experiences, in the industry sector, gave me the opportunity to work on challenging projects in different multidisciplinary environments (nano-materials, lab tools designing, and wearable sensors ) to develop products from the design to the market. 

Having a Ph.D. in Materials Science with an Applied Physics background has made me a flexible, analytical, deadline driven person who is committed to take challenging assignments and has given me the opportunity to work in diverse international environments.

I would like to continue working in R&D environments to develop even more my skills - both technical and personal – to help the company's overall growth and success.

projects.title: Micro TV-MEMS structure
projects.description:
Micro-Electro-Mechanical Systems (MEMS) have developed as a technology that contains miniaturized
mechanical and electro-mechanical elements manufactured through microfabrication techniques.
This report presents the design and fabrication of a MEMS structure for a micro-TV implementation,
specifically focusing on the design of a micromirrorbased XY-stage. The XY-stage utilizes four sets
of unidirectional combs as electrostatic actuators. The design is inspired by the raster scan image
reconstruction algorithm used in display technologies. The fabricated MEMS device incorporates a suspended micro-mirror, actuation beams, combs, and foldedflexure spring structures to enable precise positioning in two perpendicular directions. The report details the materials and methods employed, including the initial design, analytical modeling, micro-fabrication steps, and mounting and wire-bonding processes. Optical microscopy and white light interferometry techniques were employed to evaluate the fabricated samples. The results highlight the observed structures, contamination issues, and stiction challenges. Further investigations are necessary to address stiction issues and optimize device performance.

profile_positions.description: This project is to design and implementation of a PCB-based pulser circuit for driving a Piezoelectric Micromachined Ultrasonic Transducer (PMUT) array. The pulser circuit is divided into two main sections, namely digital and analogue circuits, to achieve precise control and high-performance output. The half-bridge pulser is designed to generate pulsed waves with a voltage range of up to 60V and a frequency span from 1 kHz to 10 MHz, catering to various applications. The system consists of two separate PCBs - the pulser circuit and a motherboard. The mother board facilitates the centralized control of five different channels, providing versatility for multi-channel PMUT array operation.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: I worked as a lecturer at the science faculty of IAU and taught physics and nanomaterials courses for graduate and postgraduate students. As a researcher, I also defined some research projects in relation to industry to solve their problems in the nanomaterials field. In this regard, I have supervised some talented students on research teams working in the nanomaterial lab. I have hands-on experience working with high-tech laboratory instruments.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Professor

profile_positions.description: We worked as a team and managed the postgraduate research programs and projects. It included managing and mentoring the postgraduate students, coordinating and scheduling research activities, and ensuring that all research is conducted in compliance with university policies and guidelines. We worked closely with the faculty and department heads to develop and implement research strategies and also acted as a bridge between the university and external partners or supporter companies. We were also responsible for preparing and managing research materials and budgets.
profile_positions.title: Research Manager

profile_positions.description:
Laye rooyan part (LRP) company was established in May 2017 in Isfahan Science and Technology Town with a group of shareholders who were experts in the field of nanotechnology and nanomaterials.
I worked in Laye Rooyan Part (LRP) Company on two industrial projects entitled: Wearable Non-invasive Nanobiosensor and Rapid Sensing of Drug using Molecular Imprinted Polymer as an R&D engineer. As an R&D Engineer, I designed, developed, and tested new nanomaterials and products based on our projects. We conducted experiments, created technical documentation, and communicated with customers and suppliers. I, as an R&D engineer, was responsible for product and service performance.
profile_positions.title: Research And Development Engineer

profile_positions.description: I was a project manager for designing and prototyping tools for a science museum. I was responsible for leading and managing the design and development of tools that were used in the museum's exhibits. This included coordinating a multidisciplinary team, as well as external vendors and contractors, to ensure that the project was completed on time, within budget, and to the standards required by the museum. This role also involved managing the production and installation of the tools and exhibits, as well as overseeing the maintenance. This position also included managing the budget and resources for the project, ensuring that all stakeholders were informed of the progress and any issues.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description: As an R&D Advisor for Iran Science and Technology Museum (IRSTM), was responsible for researching and developing new exhibit ideas and events, as well as providing expert advice on scientific accuracy and relevance. I collaborated with other departments to design and implement educational and engaging exhibits and events to increase the number of visitors.
profile_positions.title: Senior R&D Advisor

profile_positions.description: As an R&D, I managed multidisciplinary teams to produce lab tools for different grades. I was responsible for leading and overseeing the research and development of new lab tools. It included managing some teams of R&D engineers, coordinating with other departments and external partners, and ensuring that the production process was efficient and cost-effective. I also had to ensure that the new products or services were designed and developed to meet consumers and mass production standards as well. Additionally, we were responsible for monitoring the progress of the projects, and for making strategic decisions to ensure that the projects were completed on time and within defined budget.
profile_positions.title: R&D Manager

profile_positions.description: EEI company is a leading company in designing and manufacturing lab tools for different grades from pre-school to university.  We designed and developed new tools to cover the consumers’ hidden requests. We worked in some multidisciplinary research teams to design new products considering mass production issues, analyse data, and create technical documentation. We were responsible for product performance and meeting industry standards. We also worked closely with other departments, such as manufacturing and quality control, to ensure products are manufactured and tested to meet company and industry standards.
profile_positions.title: Research And Development Engineer
